Package com.poli.human_resources_managment_server.db

Class EmployeeDAO

java.lang.Object
com.poli.human_resources_managment_server.db.EmployeeDAO
public class EmployeeDAO extends Object
Data Access Object for managing employee data in the database. This class provides methods to insert, retrieve, update, remove, and relocate employee information.

  • Method Details

    • getEmployeeById

      public Employee getEmployeeById(int id)
      Retrieves an employee from the database by their ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the employee to retrieve.
      Returns:
      An Employee object if found, null otherwise.

    • insertEmployee

      public boolean insertEmployee(Employee employee)
      Inserts a new employee into the database.
      Parameters:
      employee - The Employee object containing the data to be inserted.
      Returns:
      true if the insertion is successful, false otherwise.

    • updateEmployee

      public boolean updateEmployee(Employee employee)
      Updates the data of an existing employee in the database.
      Parameters:
      employee - The Employee object containing the updated data.
      Returns:
      true if the update is successful, false otherwise.

    • removeEmployee

      public boolean removeEmployee(int id)
      Removes an employee from the database based on their ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the employee to remove.
      Returns:
      true if the removal is successful, false otherwise.

    • relocateEmployee

      public boolean relocateEmployee(int employeeId, String cityName, String locationAddress, String departmentName)
      Relocates an employee to a new department and records the change in the historical record.
      Parameters:
      employeeId - The ID of the employee to relocate.
      cityName - The name of the city where the new department is located.
      locationAddress - The address of the location within the city.
      departmentName - The name of the new department.
      Returns:
      true if the relocation and historical record insertion are successful, false otherwise.
